title.value: Autonomic nervous system modulation during self‑induced non‑ordinary states of consciousness
title.justification: This was retrieved from the title section of the provided research paper.
title.quote: Autonomic nervous system modulation during self‑induced non‑ordinary states of consciousness

extractions.description: This paper investigates the impact of self-induced cognitive trance (SICT) on autonomic nervous system modulation by examining changes in heart rate variability (HRV) and respiration rate variability (RRV) in different states including resting, SICT, and a mental imagery task.

type.justification: The study employs experimental procedures, including data collection and analysis of physiological metrics (HRV and RRV), to derive conclusions about the impact of SICT on autonomic nervous system modulation.
type.quote: In this study, we aimed to investigate the impact of SICT on the cardiac and respiratory signals of 25 participants proficient in SICT.

name.justification: The study focuses on understanding the modulation of the autonomic nervous system through self-induced cognitive trance, which is a topic within the field of neuroscience.
name.quote: The objective of this study was to examine the physiological mechanisms of autonomic nervous system underlying SICT, focusing specifically on heart rate and breathing modulation during this non-ordinary state of consciousness.

name.justification: The paper studies the psychological and physiological effects of SICT, which falls under the domain of physiological psychology.
name.quote: These findings suggest that SICT is associated with a reduction in parasympathetic activity, indicative of a hyperarousal state of the autonomic nervous system during SICT.

name.justification: The paper mentions the clinical applications of SICT, like treatment of mood disorders and pain reduction.
name.quote: Self-induced cognitive trance (SICT) is gaining attention due to its potential clinical applications.

name.justification: The Linear Discriminant Analysis Classifier was utilized in the study to discriminate between different states based on HRV and RRV features.
name.quote: Subsequently, we employed a machine learning framework utilizing a linear discriminant analysis classifier and a cross-validation scheme to identify the features that exhibited the best discrimination between these three conditions.
